game_state.analysis: Board has 4 empty spaces. Highest tile: 256 (2^8).
game_state.strategy: Keep highest tiles in a corner and maintain merge paths.

reflection: Up compressed columns 0 and 1: two 2’s became a 4 and two 4’s became an 8, creating one more empty space while leaving 256 safely in the bottom-right. The move was the best of the set—progress without destabilizing the corner stack. The board is still top-heavy; alternating up and left should keep feeding merges into the right column and grow the 128→256 chain. Avoid right/down, which could dislodge the 256 or clog lines. Try to lift the new 2 at (2,0) upward next turn to prepare another merge.

game_state.analysis: Board has 4 empty spaces. Highest tile: 256 (2^8).
game_state.strategy: Keep highest tiles in a corner and maintain merge paths.

reflection: Up merged the two 4-tiles in column 0 into an 8, slid the 2 above them, and spawned a 2 at (3,1); net gain: one small merge, board still at 4 empties, 256 remains anchored bottom-right. The move was modestly effective—kept the high tile cornered and did not reduce space—but created no follow-up merge chains in rows 0–1, so the center columns are starting to clog. Continue prioritizing Up/Left to feed larger tiles toward the bottom-right stack, and watch column 1 congestion; a timely Left could pair the 32s and open new space.

game_state.analysis: Board has 4 empty spaces. Highest tile: 256 (2^8).
game_state.strategy: Keep highest tiles in a corner and maintain merge paths.

reflection:
The right swipe merged the two 8-tiles in row 2 (3 → 4), created a 16 and opened an extra gap; the new 2 spawned harmlessly at (1,0). 256 stayed anchored in the bottom-right, and the right column is now 256-128-64-16, a strong merge ladder. Empty count stayed at four, so the board is still breathable.

Good move: it scored, preserved the corner strategy and improved board order.

Watch for: isolated 2’s creeping into the left half; they can freeze rows if ignored.

Next: keep sliding Right/Down to compress toward the bottom-right; avoid Up unless desperate to prevent dislodging the 256.

game_state.analysis: Board has 5 empty spaces. Highest tile: 256 (2^8).
game_state.strategy: Keep highest tiles in a corner and maintain merge paths.

reflection: Up combined the two 2-tiles in column 2 into an 8 and merged the pair of 2-tiles in column 1 into a 4, netting +2 empty squares; after the new spawn you still gained one extra space (4 → 5). 256 stayed anchored in the bottom-right, so the corner strategy is intact. Good move: it advanced tile values, improved board looseness and preserved ordering. Watch the freshly spawned 2 at (3,2); if the bottom row clogs you’ll lose the 256 corner. Prefer more up/left sequences to clear column 2 and funnel new merges toward the right column.

game_state.analysis: Board has 4 empty spaces. Highest tile: 256 (2^8).
game_state.strategy: Keep highest tiles in a corner and maintain merge paths.

reflection: Down kept the 256 anchored and slid every column smoothly, but it yielded zero merges and cost one empty slot (5 → 4). Column 0 merely shuffled 8-2 downward and spawned a new 2 on top, so no pairing potential was created. Repeated space-losing moves like this can clog the board; always look for turns that both respect the corner strategy and create or set up merges (e.g., left could have joined the two 2-tiles on the bottom row next). Prioritize moves that grow space or prepare obvious combines before defaulting to safe “corner-holding” slides.

game_state.analysis: Board has 4 empty spaces. Highest tile: 256 (2^8).
game_state.strategy: Keep highest tiles in a corner and maintain merge paths.

reflection: After the Down move, column-3 merged two 8’s into a 16, opening the top-left cell but leaving only four empties overall; the 256 tile stayed in the bottom-right corner, so the corner strategy is intact.  Gain was modest (one merge, no new chain toward 256), and Down was only the third-best option earlier, so efficiency was average.  The centre columns are filling with low tiles that block future vertical merges—watch that buildup.  Keep feeding tiles toward the bottom-right by alternating Right and Down when merges exist, but reset with Left/Up if the board starts to choke.

game_state.analysis: Board has 5 empty spaces. Highest tile: 256 (2^8).
game_state.strategy: Keep highest tiles in a corner and maintain merge paths.

reflection: Up compressed the board well: the two 2s fused into a 4 at (0,0) and the 16s combined into stacked 32s, adding one extra empty cell (5 total). Highest tile (256) remained in its corner, so the structure is intact and merge paths are clearer. Good choice. Next, an immediate Up will turn the twin 32s into a 64, but clear the small 2/4 in column 1 soon—Left after the merge keeps the corner column heavy and spawns new tiles safely bottom-left.

game_state.analysis: Board has 6 empty spaces. Highest tile: 256 (2^8).
game_state.strategy: Keep highest tiles in a corner and maintain merge paths.

reflection: Moving up combined the two 32-tiles into a 64 (col 2), slid smaller tiles upward, and left one extra empty cell (6 open now). The 256 stayed anchored in the bottom-right, so the corner strategy remains intact and the board is looser—overall a good, low-risk move. Column 2 now holds 64-4-2, giving a clear vertical merge path; columns 0–1 are still thin and safe. Keep alternating up/left to compress toward the upper edge while protecting the 256 corner, and avoid “right” unless you first lock larger tiles along that edge to prevent the 256 from drifting.

game_state.analysis: Board has 6 empty spaces. Highest tile: 256 (2^8).
game_state.strategy: Keep highest tiles in a corner and maintain merge paths.

reflection: The right move merged the two 4-tiles in row 2, creating an 8 and opening an extra space; the new 2 that spawned at (2, 1) kept the empty-cell count at six. Highest tile (256) remains anchored in the bottom-right corner, so the overall structure is still sound. Watch the pair of 2-tiles in column 1—an Up swipe would combine them and re-compress the left side, while still protecting the corner stack. Keep alternating Up/Left to clear low tiles and avoid pushing the big block off its corner.

game_state.analysis: Board has 6 empty spaces. Highest tile: 256 (2^8).
game_state.strategy: Keep highest tiles in a corner and maintain merge paths.

reflection: The right move produced no merges—tile positions shuffled slightly, empty-space count stayed at six, and the 256 remained safe in the bottom-right corner. Because score and board flexibility didn’t improve, the move was essentially a wasted turn. Repeated non-merging slides risk clogging lanes and forcing an eventual left move that would dislodge the 256. Keep favoring up/down moves that consolidate columns and create merge chains along the right edge; only use left/right when a clear merge is guaranteed.
